definition: abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])

sentences.english: Safeguarding stability is becoming an important task of local government.
sentences.chinese: 維穩越來越成爲地方政府的重要任務。

sentences.english: " According to Zhang Jiliang, this is his striving to "holding stability and pioneer" of the holy grail.
sentences.chinese: 據張繼良介紹，這是他爭當“維穩先鋒”的制勝法寶。

sentences.english: Maintaining stability has become a hot topic for Chinese society.
sentences.chinese: 維穩已經成爲中國社會的頭號大事。

definition: to crack down on/to take severe measures against
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to confer/to consult/to negotiate/to hold a conference
hawk faction (opposite: 鸽派, doves)/fierce and combative party/war party/warmongers
(economics) to reduce/to curtail/to cut back/to tighten/austerity/tightening/crunch
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
